text: The Samaritan Museum is an Ethnographic and Archaeological Museum in Mount Gerizim, near Nablus. the museum is explores and presenting the culture of the Samaritans people. The museum is the only museum in the world dedicated to Samaritans and their language. The museum was opened in 1991. == Gallery == Mount Gerizim the site of the Samarities (14532535100) (2).jpg| Kiryat- Luza-25.jpg| Kiryat-Luza-22.jpg| == Other websites == Category:Museums in Israel Category:Abrahamic religions Category:Ethnic groups in Israel Category:Religion in Israel Category:Samaritans
